issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: Just after posting this issue I noticed that version of libgazebo was 7.6 on that computer. Hopefully, it is fixed in 7.7.
content.html: Just after posting this issue I noticed that version of libgazebo was 7.6 on that computer. Hopefully, it is fixed in 7.7.

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw:
It fails with gazebo 7.7 also, with the same message
`gzserver[23163]: segfault at 10 ip 00007f7181ee2b7e sp 00007f7136ffc700 error 4 in libgazebo_transport.so.7.7.0[7f7181e9d000+69000]`
content.html: It fails with gazebo 7.7 also, with the same message gzserver[23163]: segfault at 10 ip 00007f7181ee2b7e sp 00007f7136ffc700 error 4 in libgazebo_transport.so.7.7.0[7f7181e9d000+69000]

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box
Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw:
Is this happening for all tasks? Which world are you using? What messages do you see on the terminal before the crash? For example:

~~~
[Msg] Task [1] - Started: time will start counting as you leave the box.
[Msg] Started box contains plugin [task1/start]
[Msg] Task [1] - Checkpoint [1] - Started (65 21000000)
[Msg] Started box contains plugin [task1/checkpoint1]
~~~
content.html:
Is this happening for all tasks? Which world are you using? What messages do you see on the terminal before the crash? For example:

[Msg] Task [1] - Started: time will start counting as you leave the box.

[Msg] Task [1] - Checkpoint [1] - Started (65 21000000)
[Msg] Started box contains plugin [task1/checkpoint1]

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: Thanks. If you're building from source, one thing that might help when upgrading Gazebo versions is to recompile your whole stack (delete the build folder).
content.html: Thanks. If you're building from source, one thing that might help when upgrading Gazebo versions is to recompile your whole stack (delete the build folder).

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: I have seen this happen right after the Task 1 Checkpoint 1 message is posted on the console. I'm *not* building from source, using only the packaged competition software.
content.html: I have seen this happen right after the Task 1 Checkpoint 1 message is posted on the console. I'm not building from source, using only the packaged competition software.

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: If you are running inside docker, you can pass `--ulimit core=1000000000:1000000000` to the `docker run` command so that it will generate corefiles. I think they will be created in `~/.ros/`. That could be useful for indicating what caused the seg-fault.
content.html: If you are running inside docker, you can pass --ulimit core=1000000000:1000000000 to the docker run command so that it will generate corefiles. I think they will be created in ~/.ros/. That could be useful for indicating what caused the seg-fault.

srcsim is installed using apt-get.

log file: /home/ninja/.ros/log/c3d2c4d0-400f-11e7-933f-94de806528fb/gazebo-6*.log

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: I suspect these Gazebo transport errors are due to race conditions, which is really tough to reproduce and debug. If anyone is running the competition through gdb, it would be great to get a backtrace.
content.html: I suspect these Gazebo transport errors are due to race conditions, which is really tough to reproduce and debug. If anyone is running the competition through gdb, it would be great to get a backtrace.

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: Thanks for the backtrace. This is pointing towards something in the [Task::Update](#!/osrf/srcsim/src/6db6b8f83506d358b5b10784db022e8c0c516309/src/Task.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Task.cc-129) function.
content.html: Thanks for the backtrace. This is pointing towards something in the Task::Update function.

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw:
Can you provide console output and a multi-thread backtrace next time?

~~~
(gdb) thread apply all bt
~~~

The line you've pointed at just looks like it's waiting for the mutex to be freed. Does the simulation crash or is it just hanging at this point?
content.html:
Can you provide console output and a multi-thread backtrace next time?

(gdb) thread apply all bt

The line you've pointed at just looks like it's waiting for the mutex to be freed. Does the simulation crash or is it just hanging at this point?

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: We are seeing this occur with more frequency; I'm running on r744, and 20% of our recent 'batch' runs exhibited this.  (I'm trying to modify the batch to auto generate a thread apply bt all, but it's tricky).  My team mates report similar increases of occurrence of this.  It could be something in the patches from 0.6 to 0.7 increased the likely hood of this.  Could just be superstition.  (Timing bugs are *so* much fun!)
content.html: We are seeing this occur with more frequency; I'm running on r744, and 20% of our recent 'batch' runs exhibited this. (I'm trying to modify the batch to auto generate a thread apply bt all, but it's tricky). My team mates report similar increases of occurrence of this. It could be something in the patches from 0.6 to 0.7 increased the likely hood of this. Could just be superstition. (Timing bugs are so much fun!)

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: In contrast I'm seeing fewer problems. Have you updated Gazebo? A new package dropped last night...I think it was last night. Was up 24 hours and just go up from 4 hour hap.
content.html: In contrast I'm seeing fewer problems. Have you updated Gazebo? A new package dropped last night...I think it was last night. Was up 24 hours and just go up from 4 hour hap.

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: ah, interesting.  Did not know about 7.8.1.1; was on 7.8.0.1.  Will try that and see.  Thanks for the tip!
content.html: ah, interesting. Did not know about 7.8.1.1; was on 7.8.0.1. Will try that and see. Thanks for the tip!

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box

content.raw: 7.8.1.1 did seem to improve stability.  But I did get a run of gazebo crashes.  This was on a random world, using  r744 with r749 (harness) patched in.  The crash came when commanding the sim to start T3CP6.  I got a few in a row; attaching one of the traces in the off chance it helps.  I'll shift to a non random world and see if I can reproduce.
content.html: 7.8.1.1 did seem to improve stability. But I did get a run of gazebo crashes. This was on a random world, using r744 with r749 (harness) patched in. The crash came when commanding the sim to start T3CP6. I got a few in a row; attaching one of the traces in the off chance it helps. I'll shift to a non random world and see if I can reproduce.

issue.title: Segfault in gazebo when robot moves out of start box
